data.text: @Rightsof_Man @CDCgov Yes, this is the latest seroprevalance data (assumes (judiciously) everyone mounts an antibody response and the antibody is permanent at a titer to be detected). The math with >100M infected really gets you fast.
@Rightsof_Man 43% of the population infected was latest @CDCgov estimate based on serology. So yeah! The math gets you.

@DrAliSKhan CDC numbers are ballparking 24% of the pop being infected. Therefore, we are looking between 24% to 43% of the pop.

With a Long Covid rate of 30%, 7.2% to 12.6% of the pop has LC. 

IOW, 1:8 to 1:14 people have a (permanent) Illness that we don't know how to cure. 

Devastating!

@farrah_grant Here is the website to check your county. Based on a composte metric, not just case counts.
https://t.co/gfCBRWf3rh https://t.co/k5S6dit1fZ
@DrAliSKhan We still have high rates of community transmission (this graphic is from the CDC website) yet the CDC says it’s safe to unmask. I can’t reconcile this. https://t.co/FSBjtKlz59

@DrAliSKhan Unfortunately, that only speaks to our failure.

They dream of herd immunity, but they are only thinning the herd.
